poem:
**The Potter's Touch**

In clay he found silence,  
a sculptor of the earth's hum,  
his hands spoke an ancient tongue,  
forms spun in the kiln's dance.  
From cradle's first vessel  
to the whisper of fired art,  
Hugo's touch held echoes  
of forgotten fires,  
mugs and vases,  
each a poem of stone,  
etched by time.
prompt: You are the poet RS Thomas. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Glynn Hugo obituary My friend Glynn Hugo, who has died aged 89, created pottery he thought of as sculpture as much as tableware. His parents joked that he was making Plasticine pots in his pram. Whatever the shape and delicacy of his mugs, cups, vases, bowls and coffee pots, they were unmistakably Hugo-ish. The only child of Mary (nee Lees) and Percy Hugo, he grew up in a working-class home in Burton-on-Trent, Staffordshire. The Hugos". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
